question:
A company wants to improve the availability and performance of its hybrid application. The application consists of a stateful TCP-based workload hosted on Amazon EC2 instances in different AWS Regions and a stateless UDP-based workload hosted on premises.

Which combination of actions should a solutions architect take to improve availability and performance? (Choose two.)

options.A: Create an accelerator using AWS Global Accelerator. Add the load balancers as endpoints.
options.B: Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution with an origin that uses Amazon Route 53 latency-based routing to route requests to the load balancers.
options.C: Configure two Application Load Balancers in each Region. The first will route to the EC2 endpoints, and the second will route to the on-premises endpoints.
options.D: Configure a Network Load Balancer in each Region to address the EC2 endpoints. Configure a Network Load Balancer in each Region that routes to the on-premises endpoints.
options.E: Configure a Network Load Balancer in each Region to address the EC2 endpoints. Configure an Application Load Balancer in each Region that routes to the on-premises endpoints.

explanation: Global Accelerator improves availability and performance for hybrid applications. NLB is required for TCP and UDP workloads (ALB only supports HTTP/HTTPS). NLBs handle both the EC2 endpoints and on-premises endpoints.
